Description: Fragment of North Ionian black-figured pottery bowl; glaze fired orange-red. Interior glazed; exterior, two friezes separated by band (?with added colour): above, a feline to right; its forepaws and one foreleg preserved; below, a swan to right; its head, body, and wing preserved; round, unincised rosettes in the field.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Egyptian Museum, Cairo. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Very likely to be from the same vase as Alexandria 19869 and associated sherds.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 17, no. 55, pl. 14)
Edgar 1911 / Catalogue Générale des antiquités égyptiennes du musée du Caire, Greek Vases (p. 13)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.501)
